Corporate media has discovered yet another ridiculous workplace buzzword: quiet cracking. Instead of just calling it burnout like we’ve all known for decades, they’ve rebranded it into a new epidemic of employees being tired, unmotivated, and unfulfilled at work. In this video, I break down what quiet cracking really means, why these terms always blame workers instead of companies, and how business “experts” spin employee exhaustion into a bottom-line problem. From absurd analogies to bad corporate advice, this is just a
title: "QUIET CRACKING" - THE "NEXT" DUMB BUZZWORD!
